CAMERA RISES OVER THE TREE TOPS
SHOTS OF GROTESQUE CARNIVAL IMAGES ON THE BOARD
DOWN THE STAIRCASE THROUGH THE LIVING ROOM
SOME IMAGES WE HAVE NOT ALREADY SEEN
EXT. BEACH IN FRONT OF THE BOARDWALK- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SKIMMING along the top of the water.  Moonlight on the surf.  Racing toward the beach where large bonfires burn.  TITLES AND TITLE SONG. CAMERA FLIES THROUGH FLAMES revealing:

dialogues.speaker: THE SANTA CARLA BOARDWALK
dialogues.text: This is the place where it's all happening on warm summer nights.  MUSIC and NOISE.  Arcades.  Thrill rides.  A brightly-lit Ferris wheel turning against a jet black sky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spinning merrily.  Loud CALLIOPE MUSIC.  Young kids and teenagers occupy the horses and benches.  A tough group of "SURF NAZIS" also ride.  "My Beach, My Wave" on their T-shirts. The LOST BOYS enter the carousel house.  Cool kids in dis tinctive dress.  Compelling; not threatening.  They are DAVID, MARKO, PAUL, DWAYNE; David the obvious leader. GREG, the head Surf Nazi, sits in one of the carousel's benches with his arm around his girl, SHELLY.  He thinks he's King of the Boardwalk.. And doesn't like it one bit when Shelly casts an appreciative glance toward David. David smiles back at her.  Not flirting, just being chi- valrous.  Greg scowls and takes his anger out on Paul by tripping him as he goes by.  An insult... a shove.  David joins Paul.  Surf Nazis join Greg.  The Lost Boys close ranks.  A major melee seems ready to erupt, when the ugly end of a nightstick is shoved against his Adam's apple. A three hundred pound security GUARD is at the other end. The ride suddenly ends.  CALLIOPE MUSIC STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you to stay off the boardwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For an endless moment David's and the Guard's eyes lock in mortal combat.  Neither one willing to give ground. Then David smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Boys begin to leave as the Guard turns to Greg and the Surf Nazis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, off the boardwalk.  And don't come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg and the Surf Nazis grumble and leave.  There is bad blood between them and the Lost Boys, but both groups hate the Security Guard more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRAVELS through the empty amusement park as the lights go off systematically.  CAMERA CONTINUES past the rides to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: LARGE, EMPTY PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: The Security Guard approaches his lone car carrying his lunch pail.  Deadly quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zooming down on the Guard.  A rush of air.  High-pitched SCREECHING.  WHISPERING VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD
dialogues.text: looks up -- reacts for a split second -- and then he's gone -- pulled UPWARD OUT OF FRAME so fast, he's just a blur.  Only his lunch box -- bouncing on the pavement -- remains behind.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTS OF GROTESQUE CARNIVAL IMAGES ON THE BOARD
dialogues.text: Clown faces bobbing.  Dark images in the carousel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAVES LAP against the beach.  Lonely and deserted.  No one around for miles. All is quiet and still, until... WHOOSH!  THUD!

dialogues.speaker: THE GUARD'S BODY
dialogues.text: falls from the sky and lands in the wet sand directly IN FRONT OF CAMERA. Horrible and bloodless.  Sucked dry, like a deflated balloon.  CAMERA PULLS UP, UP, UP until the coastline is visible to us.  And NIGHT DISSOLVES INTO DAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helicopter shots of the COASTLINE and HIGHWAY 17 approach ing Santa Clara:  ocean, agriculture, etc.  CAMERA FINDS a beat up LAND ROVER pulling a U-HAUL TRAILER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LUCY ANDERSON drives -- late thirties, sexy, warm, com- fortable with herself -- a bit of a free spirit.  SAM, 11, a victim of too many afternoons in shopping malls watching Bratpack movies, sits next to her in his trendy duds, suffering the foreign coastline with his large Malamute dog NANOOK. MICHAEL, in his late teens, slumps in the back seat.  He is a loner, an independent and not enjoying the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that smell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filling lungs) Ocean air!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like something died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, I know it hasn't been easy... the divorce and now the move...  but I think you're really going to like living in Santa Carla...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply.  Her sons look unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout some music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns on the radio to COUNTRY AND WESTERN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She next finds an EASY LISTENING station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She next finds Donovan singing "Mellow Yellow."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Wait.  Haight-Ashbury!  The summer of love!  'Mellow Yellow.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh as Lucy turns the dial to a CURRENT ROCK HIT and the boys relax.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE BILLBOARD
dialogues.text: Showing Boardwalk, Pier, etc. Reads:    "Welcome to Santa Carla." As they pass, only Michael notices what has been spray painted on the back of the sign:  "MURDER CAPITAL OF THE

dialogues.speaker: WORLD."
dialogues.text: MUSIC CONTINUES over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISH Summer/Fun atmos -- Bikinis, Surfers, Bikers, Colorful Locals, etc. HIGH SHOT soaks in boardwalk and surrounding area as CAMERA MOVES DOWNWARD finding Sam and Nonook in the crowd running to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the center of the action.  Lucy pumps gas into the Rover as Sam runs up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, there's an amusement park right on the beach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the boardwalk, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we go now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe later.  Grandpa's expecting us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is disturbed as she notices TWO RUNAWAY TEENAGERS RUMMAGING through a nearby garbage bin for something to eat.  She and Sam are distracted however as they see Michael rolling his HONDA MOTOR BIKE from out of the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to stretch my legs.  I'll follow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Attendant gives Lucy five dollars in change.  She hands it to Sam, indicating the Two Runaways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to get something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that poor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam runs off as Michael starts his prize possession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still mad at me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael can't deal with this and just roars his engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to check it out and meet us later it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam returns, having heard this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!?  He can and I can't?!  No fair!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, Mom.  I can see it later.  I'll help you unload.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy seems pleasantly surprised by Michael's display of responsibility.  She and Sam get in the Rover as the Runaways shout to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, thanks, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Runaways) Use some of it to call home. (to Sam as they pull out) Those kids look like me twenty years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you ran away from home, hitch- hiked to Berkeley, spent the night in Golden Gate Park and begged for spare change in the morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard this story before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many times, I'm starting to think it happened to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long winding road leads to the old lodge-like funky house.  The Land Rover pulls up followed by Michael on his motorbike. GRANDPA, a rugged individualist wearing old denims, Indian moccasins, long grey braid down his back, is a lifeless form on the front porch.  Lucy and sons approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just a deep sleeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not breathing, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy becomes concerned as she feels his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's dead can we move back to Phoenix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Lucy and Michael can belt Sam, Grandpa opens his mischievous eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playin' dead... and from what I heard, doin; a damn good job of it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Sam exchange weird looks as Lucy hugs her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large, lodge-like; funky leather furniture and Indian blankets.  Michael carries in his BARBELLS while Sam struggles with his MAMMOTH COLLECTION OF COMIC BOOKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is kind of a cool place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) I'm so excited I just can't hide it.  I'm about to lode control and I think I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you give Mom a break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam follows Michael into the...

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: As Michael, about to put his barbells down on back porch, pumps a few times for good measure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa does not own a T.V.  Have you noticed?  There's no T.V. Santa Carla has no malls, no Cineplexes and now I won't even have MTV.  I will not know anything hip happening anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Sam, we're flat broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even poor people have T.V.s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook dashes about discovering nature, while Grandpa helps Lucy unload the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy, you're the only woman I ever knew didn't improve her situation by getting divorced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big legal war wasn't going to improve anybody's situation.  We've all been through enough.  Besides I was raised better than that. Thanks for having us, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him, accidentally pulling on his braid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch, my hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I dressed like you do now, you threw me out of the house. I used to hate your short hair and your uptight suits... then I went ahead and married one... I went Yuppie and you became a hippie... Were still out of synch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is stacking his comic book collection on the shelves when Michael enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This room is mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was here first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'll flip you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam can see it's his only chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael smiles, grabs Sam suddenly and "flips" him upside down.  Michael is laughing, but his tone changes dramati- cally when Sam reaches out, grabs hold of Michael's crotc and squeezes hard.  Michael drops Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owwww!  You little shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is out the door as Michael pursues.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE STAIRCASE THROUGH THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Sam yells to Lucy, who is outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, Mom.  Help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tears open a pair of old sliding doors and runs into:

dialogues.speaker: THE OLD BAR
dialogues.text: Stuffed animals of all kinds staring down at him:  Squir- rels, birds, cats, etc. Also, boxes of eyes, pelts, hides, wooden animal forms. In other words, all the equipment and accouterments of a taxidermist.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: dashes in.  Both boys stare in wonder. The whole scene is very weird.  Suddenly a voice from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rules!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both boys jump, Grandpa is behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some rules around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa opens the refrigerator revealing a shelf with a cardboard flap on it reading:  "Old Fart."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second shelf is mine... keep my root beers and double-thick Mint Oreo cookies there... Nobody touches the second shelf...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa closes the door as Michael notices something out the window, as they follow Grandpa back towards the living room.  Michael points to a small marijuana crop growing outside.  Sam is puzzled but Michael make a "smoking a joint" gesture.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM, (CONTINUOUS)
dialogues.text: They follow Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the mailman brings the T.V. Guide on Wednesdays, sometimes the corner of the address label will curl up... You'll be tempted to peel it off.  Don't.  You'll end up rippin' the cover and I don't like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He disappears into the Taxidermy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And stay outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a T.V.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just like to read the T.V. Guide.  Read the T.V. Guide, you don't need a T.V...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, Sam and Lucy do the dinner dishes together.  The radio is playing.  A HIT FROM THE SIXTIES comes on. "Land Of A Thousand Dances."  Lucy begins to move to the music.  Then she puts down her dish towel and starts to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how we used to do it. 'Pony Time.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy grabs Sam by the hand and pulls him away from the sink.  He copies her.  In fact, he's even more wild. Lucy and Sam are laughing and having a great time.  Lucy and Sam try to include Michael, but he's embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH IN FRONT OF THE BOARDWALK- NIGHT
dialogues.text: Michael and Sam walk across the beach, around the burning bonfires.  The beach is crowded.  Greg and the Surf Nazis hang out.  It is all very strange and exciting to Sam and Michael who make their way towards the lively boardwalk. Sam fusses with his "mussed" hair and trendy clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna change my hair, my clothes, my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go up the stairs near the bandstand.  A LOUD ROCK GROUP performs.  The crows and action are exciting. Michael and Sam make their way through the young people.. Michael suddenly sees:

dialogues.speaker: STAR
dialogues.text: A heart-stopping young beauty.  Different from anyone in the crowd, listening to the music and even though she's with LADDIE, 14, a sweet-faced but sad boy, she seems alone.  As the MUSIC BUILDS, she suddenly feels Michael's gaze and their eyes meet.  She is a person looking for a friend.  Michael smiles.  Star wants to smile back, but she can't, and reaching for Laddie, disappears through the crowd.  Michael grabs Sam and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In view of the boardwalk, but quite a distance away. Lucy, in a soft summer skirt and blouse walks on the busy pier; restaurants, souvenir stores, boat rentals, etc. A "brain dead" ex-hippie is preaching; ranting and raving Lucy falls in step for a moment with a TOURIST COUPLE who are smiling over the ex-hippie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I dated that guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple chuckle and disappears in the crowd as Lucy comes across a kiosk with dozens of local ads for apart- ments for rent, fishing boats, seminars, and many flyers with missing children.  Being added to this is a xeroxed flyer with a picture of the heavyset Security Guard we saw killed.  "MISSING" in large black type over his photo This is being placed there by his WIFE AND TWO CHILDREN. Lucy passes the sad woman and their eyes meet for a second.  Lucy notices a "HELP WANTED" SIGN in a restau- rant window.  As she goes to inspect it however, she suddenly becomes aware of a YOUNG BOY looking very lost in the middle of the summer crowd.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: tending to the child. This is through a store window looking out onto the pier with the boardwalk in the distance.  A BUZZER SOUNDS. AND POV MOVES THROUGH THE DOORWAY OF A VIDEO STORE. as the LOST BOYS enter aggressively. These POV's belong to MAX, the tall good-looking friendly owner of VIDEOMAX, a trendy video/souvenier store with banks of TV MONITORS filled with rock and cartoon images. Max is not happy with the appearance of the LOST BOYS in his store, who seem only interested in causing trouble and cruising the attractive YOUNG BLACK CASHIER.  Max is just about to deal with them, when the BUZZER SOUNDS again, and Lucy enters with the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This boy seems to be lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and the Lost Boys watch Lucy and the child.  Max is delighted to see Lucy in his store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe his parents might be in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is just about to help Lucy when a frantic YOUNG MOTHER comes dashing into the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terry... Oh, thank God... I was so worried...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the child, effusively thanking Max and Lucy. Max gallantly hands a lollipop to Terry as the mother thanks them some more and leaves.  Max hands Lucy a lollipop next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles as the Lost Boys shuffle past heading for the door.  Max speaks to David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to come in here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David smiles his smile and leaves with his guys.  Max sees Lucy watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wild kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside David and the guys get on their bitchin' bikes and peel out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they're just young.  We were that age, too, once.  Only they dress better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a generous nature.  I like that in a person.  My name is Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what can I help you find tonight, Lucy?  We've got it all.  Best selection in Santa Carla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not looking for a tape.  What I need is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look that needy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks briskly past the rides through the crowds. Sam has trouble keeping up as they turn down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's the rush?  You're chasing that girl, why don't you just admit it?  I'm at the mercy of your sex glands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you have something better to do than follow me around all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, Sam realizes that he's standing directly in front of a GREAT SECOND-HAND COMIC BOOK STORE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Sam walks away from Michael.  And Michael continues his search alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weirdness hangs in the air.  Sam enters.  It seems empty. Sam begins to examine the treasure trove of comics when he suddenly becomes aware of TWO TEENAGERS, EDGAR and ALAN -- tough little dudes in fatigues with cold eyes -- victims of too many Chuck Norris movies.  They are busy stacking old comics on the racks from cardboard boxes. They are the FROG BROTHERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't put the Superman D.C. #3400 series with the #500's... it's a different artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frogs just look death at him, but Alan notices something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edgar) He's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to correct their mistake, as Sam speaks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And these Archies should be over here with the Richie Rich's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are you from, Kryton???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix actually and these Bullwinkle and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just passing through Santa Carla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm a resident as of today and you'll probably be seeing a lot of me... I've been collecting comic books all my life... perhaps you'd like to see my collection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks to Edgar as Edgar pulls a comic from the shelf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're gonna live around here, then here's one you don't wanna be without.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Sam a comic entitled Vampires Everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like horror comics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one could save your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is on Star and Laddie's tail.  He keeps pace with her, walking a safe distance behind.  She becomes aware of him.  She looks over her shoulder -- then suddenly stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you following me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want to talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... yeah.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to... I, uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes up carrying his comic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laddie notices the vampire comic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sweetly) Nice talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael argues with Lucy as Sam climbs into the Rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's early.  Why do we have to go home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring your own wheels tomorrow night and you can stay as long as you want... well 'til eleven thirty maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll hitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, you won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, you hitched all the way to Berkeley once, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, just give me five more minutes. Just five minutes, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy nods as Michael dashes off into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He met a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess no one cares what I got a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get a T.V.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael rounds the turn and stops short. Star and Laddie are surrounded by the Lost Boys.  Michael feels upstaged.  The Lost Boys look his way -- but there is nothing threatening in their expressions. They all have motorcycles.  They climb on and GUN their engines.  Star climbs on behind David, putting her arms around him. They ROAR away.  Michael is left standing alone.  Star smiles as she disappears into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bonfires from the previous night are smoldering in the morning haze.  Runaway kids sleep on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: EARLY MORNING
dialogues.text: Michael parks his bike, as he and Sam rent surf boards and wet suits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael carries his board under his arm as Sam drags his behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Sam, you know before there were malls there was 'like the ocean.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael leans to "master" the art of Surfing. He's very athletic and it doesn't take him too long to get the hang of it. Sam is disaster, however, and settles for watching Michael along with the huge Santa Carla Seals who seem- ingly applaud Michael.  Suddenly he is wiped out, however by Greg and the Surf Nazis who surf right past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My beach, my wave, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael wipes out as the Seals applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's first day on the job.  MARIA, the hot-looking blac cashier, shows Lucy the ropes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd be out on the street if it wasn't for Max.  Nobody would'a given me a job the way I looked when I walked in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen him all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He only comes in nights. He's busy opening another store in Los Gatos.  Much bigger than this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy sees Michael and Sam drive up on Michael's Honda. She goes out to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leaps off the motorbike.  Michael GUNS the engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get off in another twenty minutes.  I thought maybe we'd all get a bite together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With that, Michael peels off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is purchasing a BLACK JACKET from the PUNK STORE on the boardwalk.  He likes his reflection.  It's the kind of jacket the Lost Boys would wear.  CAMERA TRAVELS with him as he gets into his new attitude.  He stops near an EAR PIERCING CONCESSION and actually considers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a rip-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is floored to see Star standing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want your ear pierced, I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows her as they move along the busy Boardwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Your folks, too, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-hippies.  My mom was one.   I came this close to being called Moon Child, or Moon Beam or something. (beat) But Star's great.  I like Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's great.  I like Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael smiles awkwardly at Star's playfulness.  For a moment they walk in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're new around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.  We used to come here summers when I was kid.  Now we're here on a permanent basis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems pleased by that news.  Michael gives her a look He can't believe his good fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hungry?  Wanna get something to eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Michael and Star approach Michael's Honda, the Lost Boys arrive on their motorcycles.  Laddie sits behind Paul.  David is astride a THROBBING TRIUMPH.  Michael looks uneasy; out-classed and out-numbered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Star) Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at Michael) With him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David GUNS his engine, then lets it REV BACK DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) I'm David. (indicates the others) Paul... Dwayne... Marko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laddie speaks up, having been passed over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... I'm Laddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  Nobody moves, but glances are exchanged all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Star) We still going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honda 250, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Star.  Climb on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives Michael an apologetic look, then climbs onto the motorcycle behind David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know where Hudson's Bluff is? Overlooking the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David again GUNS his ENGINE and Michael gets his meaning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't beat a Triumph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to beat me, Michael. (pause) Just try to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycles BOUNCE down the steps and hit the beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they pick up speed as they spin out from the board- walk, spraying sand into the air and REVVING their ENGINES. People on the beach turn to look as the motorcycles ROAR by, heading for a more deserted section of sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of ALL FIVE MOTORBIKES weaving between the ROARING BONFIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their faces are alive with the excitement and the thrill of the ride.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Cautious.  Worried.  Doing his best to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycles speed through the surf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for the pier at full speed.  The thick wooden pilings present a hazardous obstacle course.  Michael SKIDS and slows down. The Lost Boys do just the opposite.  They increase their speed as they approach the pilings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and the others thread their way between the pilings at breakneck speed -- executing turns and avoiding col- lisions in a way that doesn't seem possible.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: travels through the pilings, trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An area of gently rolling sand dunes.  A bonfire burns beside one of these dunes.  We HEAR the THUNDEROUS RUMBLE of approaching motorcycles and one-by-one the Lost Boys sail off the edge of the dune -- fly through the flames of the bonfire -- and land upright on the beach below.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: is the last one to try this.  He's determined not to chicken out.  He speeds up the dune -- flies through the flames -- and hits the beach.  He almost falls -- but immediately rights himself. Star looks back from her position behind David and gives him a smile.  The Lost Boys also favor him with approving looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and the Lost Boys -- silhouetted against the night sky -- speed across the trestle.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL AND DAVID
dialogues.text: now travel side-by-side.  Star's hair blows in the wind. She reaches out her hand toward Michael.  Michael reaches out his.  Their hands touch for a moment -- then David turns to Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting above the noise of the WIND and the MOTORS Now we race!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David smiles -- and speeds ahead.  Michael takes off after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's Triumph streaks across the flat surface of the bluff.  Michael is not far behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bluff terminates in a shear five hundred-foot drop into the CRASHING SURF below.  And it's coming up fast.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: ROARS toward the abyss, seemingly heedless of the peril that lies before him.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: begins to show fear.  It's as is he's going to shoot off the edge of the world.  He brakes and spins out, nearly losing control of his bike, sliding toward the edge.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: BRAKES!  The tires lock and the TRIUMPH SKIDS to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: TRIUMPH'S FRONT TIRE
dialogues.text: Hanging slightly over the edge of the bluff.  The PACIFIC OCEAN CRASHES POWERFULLY against the moon-lit rocks below

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: slides next to him, slightly over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: THE BLUFF
dialogues.text: The other boys now arrive on their motorbikes.  David calmly climbs off his bike.  Michael explodes and punches him.  The other boys fall silent. Star looks to Laddie.  Michael prepares for David's retaliation, but David surprises everyone by smiling his irresistible smile at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far you willing to go, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful magic spot.  David, Michael, Star and the others climb down old condemned wooden stairs, passing huge signs on old rusted pilings reading:  "CONDEMNED," "UNSAFE," "UNLAWFUL TO GO PAST THIS POINT."  The group presses on toward a LARGE OPENING IN THE ROCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group enters and Michael can't believe his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: A VICTORIAN HOTEL LOBBY
dialogues.text: has seemingly dropped through a crack in the earth.  It is tilted and broken, but nearly intact:  Front desk, lobby mural; wrought-iron elevator, and more. Shafts of moonlight shoot down from cracks in the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was the hottest resort in Santa Carla back about eighty years ago. Too bad they built it right on top of the San Adreas fault. (beat) In 1906, when the big one hit San Francisco, the ground opened up and this place took a header into the crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you wouldn't believe the cool stuff we've found in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael glances at Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Michael.  I want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Stick around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were gonna grab some food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea. (turns) Marko.  We're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marko nods and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  All you gotta do is ask. (lights up a joint) How about an appetizer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David takes the first hit, then passes it to Michael. Star seems troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is lying in bed reading Vampires Everywhere.  Lucy enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten o'clock.  Lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy opens the closet and throws a few items inside, then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the closet door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep with the closet door open, either.  Not even a crack. (pause) Your father doesn't mind, though. It could be wide open for all he cared.  I think one of the reasons I divorced him was because he never believed... in the horror... of the closet monster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closet monster!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taken by surprise, Lucy and Sam yelp like a pair of scared puppies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!  Don't sneak up on people like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called the Indian walk. Walkin' without makin' a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa is holding something behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brought you a little somethin' to dress up your room with, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa reveals what's behind his back:  A grotesque stuffed woodchuck.  Raised up on its hind legs.  Teeth exposed.  Very ugly, indeed. Lucy and Sam hide their revulsion as Grandpa proudly places the monstrosity on the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Grandpa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots more where he came from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights out, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon as I finish this comic.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy nods and exits the room.  Grandpa follows her out. Sam is left alone to finish the comic.  But he can't concentrate.  The woodchuck seems to be staring at him. Finally, Sam leaps out of bed, grabs the woodchuck and puts him in the closet.  SLAMMING the door tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC IS PLAYING from a ghetto blaster.  Very loud.  Very hypnotic.  Dwayne makes graceful moves with a skateboard beneath his feet.  Everyone is very mellow; very dreamy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all) Where are you guys from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live here?  Your folks let you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he talking parents?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others laugh, too.  Michael looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do what we want, Michael.  We have complete freedom. (beat) Nobody knows about this place... and nobody knows about us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is intrigued -- and David sees it.  He steps closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freedom, Michael.  No parents. No rules. (smiles) Hell, we're as free as birds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marko suddenly arrives bearing cartons of take-out food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chow time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David takes the cartons from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinese!  Good choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pops the lid on one of the cartons and approaches Michael with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only rice.  Don't you like rice?  300 million Chinese people can't be wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes the carton warily and David immediately turns his back on him, passing out food to the others. Michael takes a mouthful of rice using the plastic spoon provided.  The others begin to eat as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do you like those maggots, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're eating maggots.  How do they taste?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at his food.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARTON
dialogues.text: A thousand wiggling maggots, squirming and sliding over each other.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: spits out his mouthful in horror and revulsion and throws the carton to the ground. But as the carton spills out, we see that it is just rice after all. The boys LAUGH UPROARIOUSLY.  Michael looks mortified. Star gets to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Michael.  No hard feelings, huh? (offers a new carton of food) Here.  Try these noodles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at the noodles and his expression turns to one of disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worms!

dialogues.speaker: THE CARTON
dialogues.text: A hundred squirming bloodsuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worms?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David tilts back his head and pours the contents of the carton into his mouth.  The slimy bundle of worms slides slowly across his lips. Michael looks on with a sick expression.  He grabs David's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!  Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? (beat) They're only noodles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David shows Michael the carton again.  And sure enough, they are only noodles.  Michael is baffled.  The boys have a good, long laugh at his expense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The laughter dies down as a NEW SONG comes on the radio. It's apparently a favorite of the Lost Boys because the MUSIC is immediately TURNED UP LOUD and all thoughts of Michael seem to be forgotten. Everyone begins to move to the music.  Star encourages Michael to dance with her.  He's feeling the effects of the joint he smoked and his balance is a little off.  His head is spinning. During all this, David has located a bottle of wine.  He pours some into a paper cup and offers it to Michael. Michael is about to drink when Star holds his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Don't Michael.  You don't have to.  It's blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael examines the contents of the cup and smiles know- ingly.  He's not falling for any more tricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good joke, blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael brings the cup to his lips and drinks.  The Lost Boys watch him carefully.  Wine drips from the corner of his mouth.  But it looks more like blood than anything else. Michael lowers the cup.  The room is spinning around him. Suddenly:  SLOW-MOTION.  DREAMY MUSIC.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA TAKES OFF
dialogues.text: whirling up into the air so that our VIEW of the lobby is now from HIGH ABOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael cringes in his sleep, as Sam invades his bedroom from their common bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, come on.  It's one o'clock already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam yanks open the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to watch me and entertain me, and make me appreciate the brief but happy years of childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entertain yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael pulls the covers over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam accompanied by Nanook sneak a peek into Grandpa's taxidermy room.  Grandpa is hard at work.  Sam doesn't dare go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Nanook check over Grandpa's OLD PICKUP parked in the back yard filled with fencing materials; posts, rails and boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook... this is my life:  I come from a broken home.  My mother works all day.  My brother sleeps all day.  And my Grandpa, who is possibly and alien, stuffs chipmonks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he notices the marijuana garden next to it. Running into the kitchen, he comes back with a book of matches. Breaking off a leaf, he rolls it and is just about to light it when Grandpa's voice makes him choke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam palms the evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa, stop doin' the Indian Walk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta keep in practice.  It's a dyin' art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha doin' over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I was just... having a look at your truck.  What's all that wood in there for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been fixin' to build me fence one of these days.  Bought all the materials, then put it off... for about ten years. (sighs) Well, one more day won't hurt. Wanna go into town with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  I wanna get some new comics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A classic 1957 CHEVY in creampuff condition.  Grandpa takes down an old coffee can from the tool bench and fishes out the car keys from inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slides into the car.  Grandpa climbs in behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa puts the key into the ignition and TURNS OVER the ENGINE.  It FIRED UP like a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to let her warm up a bit. Hear that, Sam?  Just like a baby pussycat. (beat) OKay?!  Let's go to town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So saying, he TURNS OFF the IGNTION.  Sam looks baffled. Grandpa climbs from the car and puts the keys back into the coffee can.  Then he turns to Sam who is still seated inside the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we havin' fun or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were goin' into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate goin' into town.  That's about as close to town as I like to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, looking very drawn and wearing sunglasses, stands before his barbells.  He pumps them once, but can't complete a second rep.  Exhausted, he drops them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is there, looking through the refrigerator.  Michael enters from the service porch and plops down in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do last night?  You look wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember much after the Chinese food that looked like maggots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That takes care of Sam's appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't suppose Grandpa's an alien, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would that make Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right... not even to mention you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook comes up to Michael and begins to lick the bottoms of his bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat it, Nanook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook continues to lick and lick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam.  Make him stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pulls Nanook away.  Then he takes a closer look at Michael's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you spill something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottoms of your feet are covered with salt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gets up from the table and starts to leave the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you it was pretty weird Chinese food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna go to the comic book store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam parks his bike outside and enters.  He begins looking around, when he sees the Frog Brothers at work as usual. They exchange glares and Sam goes to a section he likes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like Santa Carla?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty cool place if you're a Martian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a vampire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys sniffing old newsprint or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're cool, don't you? You think you know what's really happening, don't you?  Well, you don't know shit, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you think we just work in a comic book store for our dad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a comic book store, right.  It's a bakery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just our cover.  We're dedicated to a higher purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I get it... you're like those people in the airport trying to get you to give them money. You're part of a cult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fighters for Truth, Justice, and the American Way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get some fresh air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, take this... It's on the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands him a comic called Destroy All Vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like horror comics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of this more as a survival manual... there's our number on the back, and pray that you never need to call us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pray that I never need to call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy emerged from the store just as Max drives up in his sports car.  His dog, THORN, an Irish Setter, is in the seat next to him. Max leaps from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Thorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pets him) Hi, Thorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy begins to walk.  Max falls into step with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Lucy, this isn't working out like I planned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy looks alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I never get to see you. (pause) Which is, of course, why I hired you in the first place. (beat) How about dinner one night this week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy's expression tells us that she finds Max charming, in an incorrigible sort of way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're cute, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  It's so 'Eighties.' (opens her car door for her) It's the Cute Decade.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: As Star pierces it for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be a baby.  That didn't hurt and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A drop of blood appears on her finger.  She reacts, restraining herself from tasting it.  Quickly she wipes it off and inserts an earring in his ear.  He looks more like the Lost Boys every minute.  The ocean CRASHES against the rocks below them.  The moon and stars are out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have given my Mom such a hard time about moving here if I'd known I was going to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to fight with my family all the time... just got fed up and ran away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you and David...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They've made me one of them, but I miss my family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go see them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... no, everything's different now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and walks toward the water.  Michael stops her and, pulling her toward him, kisses her, leaning against the white rocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Michael...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before she can say anything else he kisses her again. The kiss becomes more passionate -- more intense. SUDDENLY LONG DARK SHADOWS LOOM ACROSS THEM.  They turn to see David, Dwayne, Paul, Marko and Laddie watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not interrupting anything, I hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gets to his feet.  He glares at David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Michael's ear) Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're almost one of us now, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm my own man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Get your bike.  We're going someplace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry... she'll be here when you get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hesitates, but is also drawn intensely to be a part of them.  He leaves with the others as they climb over the rocks toward their bikes.  Laddie has remained behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the dream again about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who, Laddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it was them, Star.  I'm sure of it.  He was working in the yard -- hammering something.  The yard was big with lots of grass.  There was no boardwalk and no ocean.  She was bringing him something cold to drink... and had red hair. (beat) I was there, too.  And a dog -- but I don't know its name.  I was running and the dog was chasing me. Then I turned around and chased the dog.  They were watching me. Drinking their cold drinks and laughing.  And I was laughing, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laddie... you can still remember. You can still remember home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a dream, Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Laddie.  It was a memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS OF THE BIKES FIRING UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Just you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me you'll keep it that way.  You're not like the others, Laddie.  You're like me. (pause) I can still remember, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds him as Michael and the Lost boys roar across the beach into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweet, fearful) You better not like him too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As young as he is, Star knows he's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trestle spans a deep gorge, obscured IN fog.  The boy arrive on their motorbikes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb from their motorbikes as David walks onto the trestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) What's goin' on, Marko?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno.  What's goin' on, Paul?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael wants to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Boys laugh.  Michael looks irritated.  He watche as Paul, Marko and Dwayne climb below the trestle, hold on with their hands and allow their bodies to dangle over the fog-shrouded gorge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Michael.  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael summons his courage and climbs down.  David follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All five boys hanging on.  The fog billowing up beneath them.  Michael starts to look down.  Then, a RUMBLING is heard in the distance.  Michael notices the look of excitement in the eyes of the other boys. A PASSENGER TRAIN is approaching.  It's WHISTLE BLOWS. The trestle begins to shake.  A look of terror comes into Michael's expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train THUNDERS across the trestle overhead, only a foot or two above them. The ROAR and the NOISE are tremendous.  The heat.  The smoke.  The dust. The boys grimace and hold on for dear life.  Then, Michael reacts in horror as:

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: releases his grip and falls, disappearing into the fog below. Then:  Marko falls.  Followed by Dwayne.  Only David and Michael remain.  David shouts over the DIN of the passing train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go, Michael!  Let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael can't believe what he's hearing.  He's scared out of his wits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David lets go with one hand, clings on with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Michael!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David lets go.  He drops from sight; vanishing into the fog below.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Sweat streaming down his face.  The final car of the train passes overhead and the noise begins to fade. Then Michael hears:  laughter from the fog below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop, Michael.  Let go!  It's safe!  Come on!  Don't be such a baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They WHISTLE and CAT CALL and do everything they can to goad him on.  All the while invisible in the darkness below. Michael lets go.  He drops into the fog. His eyes widen with fright -- but -- for a moment he is buoyant -- suspended in mid-air -- floating! And then... he drops.  With a WHOOSH.  Like dead weight. The wind RUSHING around his ears.  He loses consciousness

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: catches him in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shakes are drawn and the room is dark.  Sam rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, wake up!  It's Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom's home?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  On the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael glances at the clock.  It's two in the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fumbles for his sunglasses.  Finds them and puts them on.  Then he picks up the phone by his bed.  Sam notices how long Michael's fingernails are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael... are you freebasing? Inquiring minds want to know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gives Sam a hostile look, then speaks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT between Michael and Lucy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, are you still in bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, will you do me a favor this evening?  Will you stay home with Sam tonight?  I'm meeting Max for dinner after work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very unsympathetic) I watch him all day.  The only time I have more myself is at night.  Let Grandpa watch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa has plans of his own. (firmly) Michael, I want you to do this. Everybody has been bending over backwards for you.  You come home late.  You sleep in to the middle of the day -- Sam is always alone. You do exactly what you want... tonight do what I want for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is silent on the other end of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweet self) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hangs up the phone -- then notices his growing fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael steps into the shower stall and turns on the water.  He lets it beat against him.  Suddenly, his ex- pression turns to one of pain.  The water burns. He reaches for the handles, turns down the hot, turns up the cold.  It still burns. He turns the hot completely off.  The cold water burns! He jumps from the shower in alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam slaps together a couple of bologna sandwiches. Grandpa walks in wearing a suit and tie.  He begins to bang around through the kitchen cupboards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything in here that might pass for after shave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam locates a bottle of Windex.  Grandpa examines the bottle, squirts a little onto his hand and smells it. Then splashes it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael enters looking drawn and tired.  He still wears his sunglasses.  Grandpa is startled by his appearence but says nothing about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big date, Grandpa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slyly) Just dropping off some of my handiwork to the 'Widow' Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nasty) Oh, yeah.  What'd you stuff for her?  Mr. Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa gives Michael a look of displeasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you laters, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa goes out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) That wasn't funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa drives away from the house in his pickup truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making you a sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glances at Michael's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose the earring, Michael.  It's not happening.  It's just not happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piss off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very pleasantly) You have such a great personality, Michael.   You should open your own charm school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlight beams begin to shine in the kitchen windows, moving rapidly from one to the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Michael arrives in the living room he can hear LOUD MUMBLED WHISPERING.  Headlights flash across the window curtains, accompanied by the unmistakeable ROAR of MOTORBIKE ENGINES -- as if they were going around the house. The WHISPERING grows LOUDER.  It seems to be saying "Michael, Michael, Michael."  He goes for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of the ENGINES CONTINUES from outside.  He reaches for the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael throws open the door, and -- Nothing.  The front yard is empty.  But a blast of cold air rushes into the house and a WEIRD ECHOING sound rever berates across the sky. A low ground fog is rolling in as well.  Sam and Michael look bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael closes the door and locks it.  His face is ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy pulls up to the restaurant in her Land Rover.  Max pulls up immediately behind her in his sports car.  He jumps out, hurries over to Lucy's car and opens the door for her with a galant flourish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is in the tub.  Nanook is curled on the rug.  A radio is BLASTING ROCK MUSIC. Sam lip synching to the music, uses soap and water to sculpt his hair into a variety of punkish styles.  He's lost in the music, enjoying this activity immensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael goes to the refrigerator for some milk. Then Michael abruptly buckles over in pain.  He drops the milk carton to the floor, where it BURSTS OPEN. He straightens up, sees the mess he's made and goes to the pantry for a mop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael finds the mop -- but is then hit by another wave of pain.  He grabs his stomach and doubles over.  As he lifts his head, this is what he sees: The walls of the pantry begin to breathe!  Soup cans puff out and suck in.  Preserves seem to come alive.  The ligh bulb expands.  The floor ripples. Michael's HEART begins to POUND.  Blood surges through his veins -- causing them to bulge and ripple.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL'S MOUTH
dialogues.text: as his teeth begin to extend -- cutting his gums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Max have some wine before ordering dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The video stores are a big success. Wait'll you see the one I'm opening in Los Gatos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WAITER arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to order now, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Max) I'll just have the fillet of sole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you won't. (to Waiter) We'll start with caviar.  Ceasar salad and your two biggest lobsters. (indicates empty bottle of wine) This wine as nice, but now I think some Dom Perignon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very good, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter departs.  Max is not getting the expected reaction from Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not impressed, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohm I would have been... one marriage ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I've met the one woman on the planet who's going to hold my success against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem like a terrific guy, Max, and I'm grateful for the job...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't think it's what you really want to do, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess if I had my choice, I'd like to do something that involves children.  Work with kids in some way.  Teenagers, maybe. (beat) And Santa Carla seems to be full of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Runaways, mostly.  They come from all over.  Attracted by the boardwalk and the ocean.  Lucy... listen I know I have no right to ask you this... but don't look for another job just yet... I mean besides being the best employee I have... I think you're cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear this is the decade for cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam continues to listen to ROCK BLASTING as he creates another hair style for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael appears in the shadows.  His veins have returned to normal, but he is possessed by a strange calm. Michael begins to ascend the stairs.  We hear the sound of his HEARTBEAT. Michael reaches the second floor landing and moves slowly down the hallway toward the bathroom door.  His HEART POUNDS even LOUDER in his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is in the tub.  MUSIC blaring.  Sculpting his hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael stands outside the bathroom door.  His HEART POUNDING in his chest.  His face white as snow.  He reaches for the doorknob, then withdraws his hand.  A battle is raging within him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NONOOK raises his head and begins to WHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael has his back pressed against the bathroom door, fighting his urge and desire to enter.  LOUD, POUNDING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, unaware of Nanook's nervous behavior, disappears und the water to rinse his hair. NONOOK sits up and HOWLS -- and Michael bursts in! Michael and Nanook lock eyes.  NANOOK begins to GROWL softly.  A deep, primordial GROWL of warning.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: His lips peel back, revealing his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: NANOOK
dialogues.text: lunges at Michael, propelling both of them into the hallway.  The DOOR SLAMS shut behind them.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: surfaces for air, hears a tremendous FIGHT going on in the hallway.  THUDDING, BANGING, GROWLING and HOWLING. Tumbling downstairs followed abruptly by silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps cautiously into the hallway.  It is dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?  Are you there, Nanook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response whatsoever.  Sam swallows hard and begins to walk down the hallway. Then -- he hears HEAVY BREATHING and stops in his tracks. He looks down the dark staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Don't turn on the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns on the light -- and SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: is huddled at the bottom of staircase, his face and hands covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Michael!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Nonook?  What have you done to Nanook?!  What have you done to my dog, you asshole?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing!  I didn't hurt him.  He bit me!  This is my blood!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael shows Sam the gash across the palm of his hand. Sam reacts.  Nanook appears protectively beside Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you to do him, Michael? Why did he bite you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was protecting you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is shocked to hear this.  But gets an even greater shock when he looks at the mirror in the hallway.  He GASPS out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at your reflection in the mirror!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks, is startled to see that he is nearly invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a creature of the night, Michael!  Just like the comic book... You're a vampire, Michael!  My own brother -- a godamn shit-sucking vampire! (beat) Wait'll Mom finds out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks confused and bewildered.  He moves toward the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back!  Stay back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He makes a cross with his fingers and runs for his room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Nanook dash in as Sam locks the door and the bath room door.  He scrambles for the comic with the Frogs' number on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks in wearing a dazed expression.  He flops down on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiding the phone and the conversation from the clientele, the Frogs walk to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing, calling us.  Does your brother sleep a lot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT between Sam and Frogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't stand light?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wears sunglasses in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad breath?  Long fingernails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fingernails are longer, but he always has bad breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt sticks to the bottom of his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a vampire alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yourself a good sharp stake and drive it through his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get a garlic T-shirt, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or it's your funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLICK.  The Frogs hang up.  Sam looks even more worried than before.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Something is happening, but we can't tell what.  Yet we feel the distinct sensation of movement. BANG.  Michael's nose makes contact with a hard white surface.  It's as if something is pressing down on him.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PULLS BACK
dialogues.text: and we realize that Michael is floating above his bed! Completely weightless.  Gravity-free.  The white surface is the ceiling. Michael looks scared and confused.  He's out of control. Floating aimlessly near the ceiling like a helium balloon He wants desperately to get back down.  He tries to maneuver himself toward his bed.  He grabs hold of the blind cord. But the window is open and Michael's feet float out -- and the rest of him soon follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone RINGS.  Sam jumps and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy on the phone.  She hears the panic in Sam's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam.  Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom.  I think we've got to have a long talk about something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?  Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't talk about it on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Sam sees Michael floating in mid-air outside his bedroom window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no!  Oh, God!  He's coming to get me!  Mom!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy hears this.  She drops the phone and runs from the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE RESTAURANT
dialogues.text: The waiter arrives at Max's table with two huge lobster dinners and more Dom Perignon, just as Max sees Lucy jump into her Land Rover and burn rubber away from the restaurant.  Max is totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael rises into the night sky as far as the cord will allow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam backs away from the window with a terrified expression. Michael is bobbing helplessly in the air outside the window.  He's yelling something but we can't hear what it is.  Then, Michael's foot CRASHES through the window and we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!  Sam -- help me!  I'm your brother!

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: is shaken back into reality by Michael's cry.  He puts his fear aside and acts on instinct to save his brother. He rushes out of his room and into:

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: where he is greeted by a chilling wind that blows in through the opened window.  Sam almost has to fight his way toward the window, that's how strong the wind is. But he gets there and begins to reel Michael back inside. As Michael climbs back inside, he immediately anchors himself to the bed with the blind cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to stick together, Sam. You've got to help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  We can't tell Mom! (beat) Please, Sam.  Don't tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Michael.  This is not like breaking a lamp or getting a 'D'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a few days, Sam.  Give me a chance to work this out by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy speeds up in her Land Rover.  She practically jumps out before the car has come to a full stop.  She runs into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy rushes in to find Sam walking calmly down the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!  What happened!?  You had me scared to death.  Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mom.  It was a mistake. I thought I saw something out the window. (beat) I was reading this horror comic and I guess I go a little carried away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy looks at him with a good deal of skepticism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's already gone to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
