dialogues.text: Michael lies on his bed, totally freaked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAITRE 'D is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am very sorry.  But he is no longer here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g. we see that the table once occupied by Max and Lucy us now empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is on the phone with the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs to herself and hangs up the phone.  Then she casts a weary glance at the spilled milk carton on the floor next to the refrigerator. She grabs a dish towel and begins to mop up the milk, placing the ruptured carton on the counter in the process.

dialogues.speaker: MILK CARTON
dialogues.text: We see A PICTURE OF LADDIE on the carton's side.  And the bold letter that exclaim:  MISSING CHILD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy enters the bedroom.  Sam comes in right behind her, buttoning p.j.s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I sleep in here with you tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind?  It was a real scary comic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (sniffs) Have you been eating pizza?  You smell like garlic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights are out.  FANTASTIC SONG BEGINS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy & Sam sleep.  We HEAR the distant sound of a MOTOR- BIKE driving off,  Sam's eyes blink wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael speed away on his motorbike.  He sees approach- ing headlights -- decides to pull off and kill his engine.  Then, Grandpa drives by in his pickup truck returning from the Widow Johnson's.  SONG CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa is singing merrily to himself as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael waits for Grandpa to pass, then ROARS off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael travels the length of the boardwalk on his bike. Every attraction and booth is shut down for the night, and the place is deserted. Bonfires burn on the beaches.  SONG CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael arrives at the cliff where the lobby/cave is located.  No one is there.  He decides to enter the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael enters.  The place is deserted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for a reply -- but there isn't one.  Now Michael notices and empty bottle of wine -- the same "wine" he drank before.  He smells the bottle and recoils.  It smells of blood.  SONG CONTINUES. Michael hurls the bottle across the lobby where it CRASHES against the wall and shatters.

dialogues.speaker: VARIOUS IMAGES
dialogues.text: begin to rush through his mind.  The motorbike "rave-up" on the beach.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER IMAGE
dialogues.text: Drinking blood from the wine bottle.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER IMAGE
dialogues.text: The ear-piercing ritual and kiss with Star.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER IMAGE
dialogues.text: The "trestle-hanging" episode.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO MICHAEL
dialogues.text: As the IMAGES FADE, Michael finds himself standing in the far corner of the lobby.  Something belonging to Star lets him know that this is where she sleeps.  SONG CONTINUES. He sits down on the bed, and soon he is curled up, fall- ing asleep.

dialogues.speaker: SOME IMAGES WE HAVE NOT ALREADY SEEN
dialogues.text: Michael and Star together.  She's on the back of his bike, her arms tightly-wrapped around his waist.  They are speeding along a moon-lit beach -- or some equally romantic location.  Michael is as happy as any young man has the right to be.  SONG CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firt light begins to show in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding across the ocean, heading for the cave.  Much NOISE.  WHISTLING wind.  FLAPPING wings.  WHISPERING. SONG CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is curled up on Star's bed.  The NOISE sweeps into the cave on a cold rush of air.  Michael stirs.  He hears voices.  Then looks up to see Star coming to lie next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star.  I have to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star doesn't respond.  She's fallen right to sleep. Michael tries to awaken her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you.  Please wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to sleep.  Have to sleep, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight.  At the boardwalk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She almost doesn't get the last word out before falling back to sleep.  Michael gets to his feet and staggers away from Star's bed.  He notices Laddie sleeping nearby. But there is no sign of the other Lost Boys.  SONG ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael drives up on his Honda.  He approaches the house. Lucy is on the porch, drinking coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael nods and keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Michael? Aren't we friends anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mumbling) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean we are, or we aren't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's act like friends. Let's talk.  I know this is a new place, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael begins to roll his eyes impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If there's a girl, we could talk about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving away) I'm tired now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom... please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael heads into the house.  Lucy tugs on her own ear- lobe to indicate Michael's earring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't even gotten around to this yet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael walks into the house without saying another word. Lucy looks frustrated and concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is at the table eating breakfast and reading a vampire comic.  Grandpa is pouring a cup of coffee.  The two brothers exchange a look, but say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like I wasn't the only one got lucky last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael doesn't reply.  He glances down at the comic that Sam is reading.

dialogues.speaker: VAMPIRE COMIC BOOK
dialogues.text: A very bloody drawing of a vampire being staked through the heart.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: walks away looking ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Sam pull up in the Land Rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy checks the address she has written down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Not bad, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy reaches for a wine bottle with a note attached as she gets out of the Rover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An apology for running out on Max last night... Actually you should be making this apology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries the main gate, but finds it locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better leave this on the front porch or someone's just going to take it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs over a low portion of the fence. Lucy approaches the house.  She sees Thorn sleeping on the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Thorn...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, unexpectedly...

dialogues.speaker: THORN ATTACKS
dialogues.text: Leaping to his feet -- charging from the porch -- GROWL - ING viciously -- ribbons of saliva trailing from his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: turns and charges back toward the fence.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: jumps from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: drops the wine.  It smashes on the sidewalk.  She just makes it safely over the fence, as...

dialogues.speaker: THORN
dialogues.text: CRASHES into it -- bending the bars to conform to the contours of his head.  Thorn reels back, stunned -- but finds his footing and begins to BARK at Sam and Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: comes to his mother's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy has skinned her knees landing on the sidewalk.  But she is more shaken than hurt -- and she feels very foolish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay, Sam.  I'm okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and the Frogs walk toward the beach with their comics

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been aware of some very serious vampire activity in this town for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Santa Carla has become a haven for the undead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, we're almost certain that ghouls and werewolves occupy high positions at City Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit on the boardwalk steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something to tell you guys. (pause) Not only is my own brother showing systems of being a vampire... but now I'm convinced my mother's dating one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is very probable.  What's your reasoning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... he only shows up at the store after dark.  And today, his dog attacked my mom. (whips a comic from his back pocket) Listen to this.  From Vampires Everywhere... (he reads) 'Vampires require a daytime protector -- a Guardian -- to watch over them as they sleep. For it is during the day that the vampire is most vulnerable. Since they hold sway over animals, fierce dogs -- the hounds of Hell -- are often employed for this purpose.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frogs are completely convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you that comic would save your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Greg and the Surf Nazis appear and grab their comics.  In a flash they tear them to shreds and sprinkle the pieces over their heads onto the sand.  The Frogs and Sam are enraged as the Surf Nazis walk off laughing to themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish they were vampires so I could nuke them in their hearts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know they're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wouldn't be out in the daytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly how many vampires have you actually destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at them like they've been putting him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, just because a Marine hasn't seen combat, doesn't mean he still isn't a Marine.  Let's check out your mother's boy friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave as CAMERA FOCUSES on shreds of vampire comics in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is getting dressed to go out.  More and more he is looking like one of the Lost Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is making dinner.  Grandpa sniffs the pots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells good.  When do we eat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Max eight o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max?  You men we're having company again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Again'?  Dad... you haven't had company in this house since Mom died eight years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  An' now we're having company again.  I'll take mine to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is coming for dinner, Michael. I'd like you to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.  Got plans of my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only three weeks left of summer, Michael.  Things are going to change around here when school starts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael heads for the front door.  He opens it to find Max just preparing to ring the bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  How ya doin'?  Michael, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Max... right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence as Max just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the man of the house, Michael.  I'm not coming in unless you invite me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael thinks this is rather strange, but shrugs it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, come in.  I'm inviting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max steps across the threshold -- but is surprised to see Michael continue out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael takes special note of Max's sports car as he gets on his bike.  He thinks it's pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max enters, surprising Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it okay for the guest to see the food before the dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking of the groom not seeing the bride before the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.  I always gets those two confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He follows her into:

dialogues.speaker: THE DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: The table is set.  Lucy sets down the bread.  Max comes up behind her, puts his arms around her waist and nuz- zles her neck.  She turns her face to his.  Max is about to kiss her when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Lucy look to see Sam standing there with the Frogs beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are my dinner guests. Edgar and Alan.  The Frog Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrown) Ah... I didn't know you were having guests...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if we're in your way we can just eat peanut butter out of the jar in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... there's plenty for everybody... Oh, Max, this is Sam... and the Frog Brothers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks them over strangely but The Frogs and Sam only have eyes for Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is seated around the dinner table.  Edgar and Alan concentrate on Max's behavior.  Lucy serves spaghetti from a large plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks terrific, Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy!  Somebody areound here sure has bad breath!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys all look directly at MAx.  But Lucy means Nanook who is on her case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook, stop breathin' on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere, Nanook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frogs exchange disappointed expressions. Sam indicates Max's large plate of spaghetti.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a little Parmesan cheese on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Sam.  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes the container and sprinkles some of the grated cheese onto his spaghetti.  Sam and the Frogs exchange a conspiratorial look. Max takes a mouthful of spaghetti and nearly spits it out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max!  What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's garlic!!  I like garlic, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sputters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick -- drink some water!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam intentionally spills a glass of water onto Max's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps from his seat, tries to mop up the spill with his napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it burn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn??  Are you kidding?  It's freezing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, very casually, Edgar leans back in his chair and flips off the lights.  The room goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be a circuit breaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear SCUFFLING of FEET, CHAIRS MOVING, people BUMPING into each other in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a whisper) He's not glowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Hit the lights again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the lights come back... Sam is holding a mirror to Max's face. Startled at being confronted unexpectedly with his own reflection, Max YELLS.  Sam and the Frogs all look into the mirror -- annoyed to see that Max is producing a reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!  What's gotten into you tonight?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max gets up from the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know what's going on here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  I understand what you're thinking, Sam.  But you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm not trying to replace your Dad... or steal your Mom.  I just want to be your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks a little shame-faced.  But not the Frogs. Lucy follows Max to the:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really sorry, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our batting average isn't very good is it?  So far we're zero for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand Sam.  He's just not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys Sam's age need a good deal of discipline, or they walk all over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively) He doesn't walk all over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sweetly) I don't want to fight with you, Lucy.  Come on.  Let's give it one more try. (beat) Dinner at my house, tomorrow night.  I'm cooking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael is looking for Star, but he chances upon the Lost Boys instead.  David has his back to him.  Michael comes up behind him and spins David forcefully around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Star, David?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever want to see Star again, then you better come with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David gets on his bike.  Michael is forced to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorbikes pull up and park.  Everyone climbs off and begins to climb the high trees.  David waits to be last. He gestures for Michael to climb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, David?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one of us, now -- aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never see Star again if you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael looks at David for a beat, then begins to climb the tree.  David follows him up.

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA RISES OVER THE TREE TOPS
dialogues.text: to reveal Greg and the Surf Nazis camping in the distance.  They have a fire going.  They're drinking beer and smoking dope and laughing with their girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOST BOYS
dialogues.text: watch them from their vantage point high up in the tree. What happens next happens fast.  It's confusing and dis- orienting.  Much is suggested, but little is shown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lost Boys swoop out of the trees and attach the Surf Nazis.  Mostly, we just HEAR the NOISE and see shadows.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURF NAZIS
dialogues.text: react in horror and confusion.  CAMERA FINDS Greg running into the water.  David attacks viciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, dude.  My beach, my wave.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: stay behind in the tree.  He witnesses the attack, but doesn't join in.  From the expression on his face, we know that it is a horrible spectacle to behold. He turns his face away.  He looks like he wants to puke. Sweat beads up on his forehead and the color drains from his face.  His breathing becomes heavy and his heart begins to POUND POWERFULLY in his chest.  The vampire in him takes over and as the Lost Boys shout his name, he feels compelled to join them, but he resists with all his strength. Dazed and frightened, he tries to escape down the tree. All the while the SOUND of the VAMPIRE MASSACRE continues in the distance.  He slides gasping and sweating onto the forest floor. For a moment, he just lies there looking bewildered. Then:  SILENCE.  The attack is over. Approaching FOOTSTEPS CRUSH leaves and SNAP twigs. Michael waits, unable to move.  And...

dialogues.speaker: THE LOST BOYS
dialogues.text: emerge from the shadows wearing eerie, satiated expres- sions, their eyes glowing dimly.  They approach Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you know who we are, Michael... and who you are, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's expression is calm and reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never grow old and you'll never die. (pause) But you must feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael glances in horror toward the direction of the Surf Nazi attack.  David, Paul, Dwayne, and Marko walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is dark.  CAMERA IS CLOSE ON A PAIR OF BEADY EYES which now reflect the opening of the bedroom door and the entrance of a human form.  It comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael..?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns on the light -- and we see that the "beady eyes" belong to one of Grandpa's mounted owls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish he'd stop giving me these things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens the closet, we see about a half-dozen other mounted creatures on the shelves.  He tosses in the owl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then:  From outside the window --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!  Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Michael go to the window and look out.  Star is standing in the yard, in the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that girl from the boardwalk. Is she one of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to talk to you.  Can I come up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns from the window, races out the door into the hallway.  He is about to go down the stairs when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's one of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael turns -- and sees Star standing in the bedroom doorway.  She has obviously flown up and Sam is freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where David took me tonight, Star?  Do you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... and I'm to blame for it. If you hadn't met me... if I hadn't liked you... I tried to warn you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That night in the cave -- that wasn't wine they gave me to drink... it was blood!  David's blood. (beat) I'm one of them, Star!  I'm just like them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet... You're like Laddie and me... Half-vampires... You're not a full vampire until you've made your first kill... You were supposed to be mine... but I couldn't, Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's not too late for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late for you to be saved... but each night... it becomes harder and harder for me to resist killing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I've felt it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm weak... Soon I'll need to feed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam gulps as Michael kisses her.  Star senses something and gets frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David's looking for me... I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going anywhere... (turning) Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a wink, Star is gone... out the window.  We don't even see her leave.  Michael and Sam lean out after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) Don't kill anybody until we get back to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam goes for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you calling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam opens the door and the Frogs enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Where's Nosferatu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prince of Darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nightcrawler.  The bloodsucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: El Vampiro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) They're here Michael, come down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael comes down the stairs looking weak and fragile. Dark glasses perched upon an ashen face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy looks more like a zombie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan reaches into his backpack and pulls out a sharpened stake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I run him through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've only got one question for you, and I want an honest answer.  Have you taken any human victims yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're telling the truth, it means we can save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's telling the truth! (beat) Aren't you, Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To free you, we must destroy the leader of the vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want names!  Just lead me to him.  Where's their nest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take you there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can barely stand up.  Besides... We can't trust you.  You're practically one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael grabs Edgar by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, I'll take you there. Nobody's going near Star without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael releases his grip.  Edgar rubs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires have such rotten tempers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are far out in the fields as Grandpa puts in fence posts from the back of his pickup.  He turns as he hears his prize Chevy SQUEEL BACKWARD OUT OF THE GARAGE.  Sam leans out of the car yelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa, okay if we borrow the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can answer, the CAR SHOOTS OFF TOWARD TOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chevy pulls up to a stop sign -- then doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is why:  Michael has fallen asleep at the wheel, his chin touches his chest. A car behind HONKS.  Michael wakes up an continues driving.  Edgar warns Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just so you know:  If you try to stop us, or vamp-out in any way, I'll stake you without thinking twice about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill out Edgar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chevy pulls up an parks.  Everyone piles out.  The Frogs wear knapsacks in which they carry flashlights and stakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frogs charge ahead down the old stairs.  Michael seem to stumble.  Sam supports him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam... if something happens to me. If I don't have the strength to go on, promise me you won't let them hurt Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam swallows hard -- overwhelmed by the possibility of such a responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar and Alan step into the lobby and look around with wide-eyed wonderment.  A moment later, Michael and Sam come up behind them.  Sam is also amazed by what he sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be a sleeping chamber around here someplace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they search for the entrance to the sleep chamber, Michael goes to the spot where he knows Star will be in the far corner of the lobby. Michael bends down to her.  She looks like a sleeping angel.  He shakes her gently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star.  You're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes -- is surprised to see him, but hardly has the strength to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around, sees a long hooded cape draped on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to put this on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take laddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save Laddie first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael glances over to where Laddie is sleeping.  Star's eyes beseech him.  Michael gives in to her wishes.  He begins to wrap Laddie (who doesn't awaken) in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF THE LOBBY
dialogues.text: Alan has found something and called Edgar and Sam over. He's pointing to an opening in the top of the grated elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel it?  Feel the draft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar shines a flashlight up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an opening, all right.  Let's try it.  Somebody give me a boost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael emerges from the cave with a bundled Laddie in his arms.  The sun beats down.  Laddie awakens.  He looks around with uncomprehending eyes.  Michael adjusts the blanket to keep the sun off Laddie's face. Michael staggers up the old stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Edgar and Alan have all entered the tunnel via the elevator and now make their way down its long, dark length. FLIES begins to BUZZ around.  Sam tries to swat them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the right trail.  Flies and the undead go together like ham and eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan pulls a can of bug spray from his backpack and spray the air.  Sam coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael arrives at the Chevy with Laddie in his arms.  He opens the back door and places Laddie on the seat.  Laddi remains sound asleep as Michael makes certain that his face is covered and away from the sun. Then, turning away from the car, he heads back toward the cave.  It is obvious that he is becoming extremely exhausted and rapidly losing strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar, Alan and Sam are frozen in place with mouths hanging open.  We don't know why until the CAMERA PANS DOWN and we see:

dialogues.speaker: SKELETONS
dialogues.text: of dead hotel guests, killed in the earthquake.  They still wear their period clothes.  One holds a suitcase. One wears the bellman's uniform.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS
dialogues.text: summon their courage and continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael returns for Star.  He looks awful.  Star reaches out and touches his hand.  Michael wraps her in the hoode cape and lifts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys reach the end of the tunnel where a large openin awaits them.  A biting cold wind blows through the openin and flies BUZZ angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that smell!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires, my friend.  Vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step through the opening into a small cavernous area

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharp, jagged rock formations protrude up from the chambe floor.  A network of webs and mossy vines hang from the ceiling.  Somewhere in the distance is the HOLLOW SOUND O DRIPPING WATER.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS
dialogues.text: pan their flashlights across the scene -- but find no one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael carries Star towards the car.  He is weakening. His legs buckle and he sinks to his knees.  Star's hood falls back revealing her face.  Michael finds inspiration in her beauty and struggles to his feet, lurching toward the Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and the Frogs find nothing until they shoot their flashlight beams UPWARD.  And what they see causes their hearts to skip a beat.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOST BOYS
dialogues.text: hang upside down from the ceiling like great human bats. David is in front, with the others behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they'd be in coffins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what this place is. One great big coffin. (starting to climb) Let's stake 'em.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID'S EYES
dialogues.text: roll open.  Yellow and glassy.  His voice is from hell. The whole cave shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all dead!  YOU'RE DEAD MEAT!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS
dialogues.text: SCREAM and run for their lives.  They scramble down the rocky ledge.  They cause such a commotion, that the other Lost Boys open their eyes one by one -- glowing red in the darkness of the chamber.

dialogues.speaker: THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: The boys run through the tunnel, past the hotel guest skeletons.

dialogues.speaker: LOBBY/CAVE
dialogues.text: They dash across the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scramble up the stairs toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!  Start the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive to find Michael passed out beside the car. Sam and the Frogs shove Michael into the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't ride with vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine!  Stay here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hops in behind the wheel.  The Frogs look back toward the cave, exchange a look, and decide to make an exceptio just this once.  They leap in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar gets in front next to Michael.  Alan gets in back next to Star and Laddie.  They find it very distasteful to be this close to vampires. Sam turns the ignition and the car FIRES UP.  Hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Burn rubber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar STOMPS down hard on the gas pedal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chevy ROCKETS backwards toward the cliff.  Sam stomps on the brakes. TIRES SCREECH.  The car comes to a skidding stop in a cloud of dust -- its back fender hanging precariously over the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn rubber does not mean warp speed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We blew it, Edgar!  We lost it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We unraveled in the face of the enemy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pulled a mind-scramble on us, man!  It wasn't our fault! They opened their eyes and talked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in the rearview) Oh, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a cop behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick!  Look older!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam gives Alan a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all we need!  To be caught driving without a license... and in the possession of vampires!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael's head slumps against Edgar's shoulder.  Edgar pushes him away -- and Michael awakens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!  Get behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gaining on us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) You gotta drive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Chevy barrels down the highway, Sam and Edgar assist Michael into the driver's seat.  There is some pretty dangerous climbing going on in the front seat -- and for a moment it appears that no one has actual control of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Red light!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, Sam and Edgar look up to see the stoplight. The Chevy rushes toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brake, Michael!  Brake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael -- acting very dopey -- finally hits the brake. But Sam must take control of the steering wheel because Michael's hands keep slipping off.

dialogues.speaker: THE POLICE CAR PULLS UP BESIDE THEM
dialogues.text: The cops look over at the Chevy with a good deal of suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're looking at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna book us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edgar and Alan) Shut up. (to the cops) Uh... excuse me... which way to the Punk Rock Festival?  We're the opening act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops just smile and shake their heads in dismay.  The light changes, and the cops speed off. Everyone in the Chevy breathes a deep sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All enter.  Michael carries Star in his arms.  Sam and the Frogs carry Laddie.  As they approach the stairs, Nanook comes racing up to them, BARKING loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Nanook!  Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dog knows flesh-eaters when he smells 'em!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook continues to BARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him outside, Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam grabs Nanook by the collar and leads him away.  The others begin to climb the stairs -- when Grandpa appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone freezes in place.  Grandpa looks the over. They must certainly be the most curious group of people he's ever seen going up the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael; continuing) Do you know the rule about filling the car up with gas when you take it without askin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Grandpa...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa departs.  It takes a moment to register, then everyone hurries up the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar and Alan watch from the hallway as Michael makes Star and Laddie comfortable on his bed.  Sam comes up the stairs, looks into the bedroom, then turns to the Frogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... we blew Plan A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to activate Plan B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Plan B?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have one yet. (looks at his watch) And we only have two and a half hours to come up with one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens in tow and a half hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dun goes down and they'll be comin' for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun begins to sink behind the archway cross.  CAMERA PANS DOWN to find Sam and the Frogs charging in on their bikes.  They drop them, run up the steps into the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys enter.  A christening is taking place within the church, but nobody notices as the Frogs pour the holy water from the bowls near the doorways into their canteens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun begins to set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters and goes running up to Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!  Listen to me!  This is very important!  Santa Carla is crawling with vampires!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy reacts.  A customer looks over at Sam.  Lucy takes Sam aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vampires, Mom!  Everywhere! You've got to tell the police! The newspapers!  The TV stations! They'll listen to you.  They'll believe you...  you're a mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not funny, Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a joke.  They know that we know about them.  They're coming to the house as soon as it gets dark!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, Sam.  Stop it right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another word!  I can't believe you're doing this.  I'm going to see Max tonight and you're trying to ruin it for me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with Max.  I don't know why you don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) -- I'm not talking about Max!  To hell with Max!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy reacts.  More customers look over.  Sam winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll deal with you later, young man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam emerges from the store.  The Frogs are waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar and Alan exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just the way we like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam comes in to find Grandpa working on one of his mounted animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa, the Widow Johnson called. She said to pick her up a seven instead of eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Did we have a date tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so.  She said not to be late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better get cleaned up, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa takes off in his pickup truck as the sun sinks lower.

dialogues.speaker: SEQUENCE
dialogues.text: 182         Michael locks doors and windows, boarding som 183         Sam prepares bowls of garlic in the kitchen. 184         The Frogs pour some holy water into a full ba 185         They fill water guns with holy water. 186         Edgar and Alan supply camouflage makeup using in Soldier of Fortune magazine as their guide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael goes to the window.  It looks as if his strength is returning. He pulls back the curtain and looks out.  He has a commanding view of Santa Carla.  The sun has just dropped below the horizon. Michael turns to Laddie and Star who begin to stir from their resting place on the bed.  Star and Michael exchange an anxious expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be coming for Laddie and me, won't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be coming for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Michael goes to his closet and takes out a very serious-looking hunting bow and arrow quiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max opens the door to Lucy and ushers her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this is the night where everything finally goes right for a change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max picks up a note of concern in Lucy's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  Just worrying about my boys -- as usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting her some wine) Let me tell you something about boys.  They're like weeds.  They grow best when they're ignored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the wine glass) I thought you said they needed discipline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... what do I know?  I'm a bachelor. (pause) Lucy... this is going to be a very special night, I promise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to go, but she stops him.  He looks confused, then sees what she has in mind.  She kisses him on the lips.  It last a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting the cave, and suddenly... we are flying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Lucy are kissing passionately on the sofa when a DISTANT NOISE is HEARD in the sky overhead.  Lucy notices but Max is too involved to hear anything. Thorn, however, sits up and begins to HOWL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Michael, Edgar, Alan, Star and Laddie are assembled for final instructions.  Sam and the Frogs carry loaded water guns.  Michael has his bow and arrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should warn you all: It's never pretty when a vampire buys it.  No two bloodsuckers ever go out the same way.  Some scream and yell.  Some go quietly.  Some explode.  Some implode.  But all will try to take you with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Sam exchange a look.  Then, Nanook begins to BARK from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook!  I left him tied up in the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go out there!  Stop him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, don't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam races across the lawn in the moonlight toward Nanook, tied up near Grandpa's vegetable garden.

dialogues.speaker: FLYING OVER THE TREE TOPS
dialogues.text: Moving toward Grandpa's house far in the distance.  Sam can be seen running toward Nanook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reaches Nanook, who is now BARKING frantically.  Sam tries to untie him.  Has difficulty with the knot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rushing in toward Sam and Nanook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam frees Nanook.  The two of them run toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweeping in toward the yard.  Sam running below.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: dashing toward the house as VAMPIRE SOUNDS fill the air behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now skimming over the grass -- speeding toward Sam and Nanook.  Getting closer... closer... closer.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: arrives at the door.  Runs into the house as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has door SLAMMED in its face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leans against the front door, totally out of breath. Everyone is relieved to have him back safely. Then...

dialogues.speaker: DWAYNE
dialogues.text: EXPLODES from out of the fireplace!  Everyone SCREAMS. Dwayne flies across the room kicking Michael in the face. Michael goes down as Dwayne grabs Sam and lifts him into the air. Star grabs Laddie and rushes him up the stairs to safety. Alan and Edgar swat baseball bats at Dwayne -- Dwayne, mid-air above them, still has Sam by the arm. But Sam uses his free hand to draw his water gun and spray Dwayne in the face. Dwayne falls and CRASHES into the stereo, turning it on. LOUD ROCK MUSIC begins to BLAST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star hides Laddie under the bed.  She notices that the bedroom window is not closed.  She moves to close it when it EXPLODES in her face and:

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: flies into the bedroom.  Star SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys hear Star's scream.  The Frogs rush up the stairs.  Dwayne BELLOWS in protest -- and a beam of light shoots out from his mouth.  Sam continues to squirt him in the face.  The water burns his eyes, blinding him. Enraged, Dwayne becomes a disgusting and hideous sight with flashing fangs and purple face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frogs and Star collide in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Paul...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where he went.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar glances around.  Notices that the boys' bedrooms are on one side of the house and Lucy's is on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Star; indicating Lucy's bedroom) Check that room! (to Alan; indicating Sam's bedroom) You take that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar takes Michael's bedroom himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar cautiously enters the room -- water gun drawn. The bathroom door opens behind him and Paul quietly steps out.  He looks as horrible and nasty as Dwayne.  His face evil and rotting.  His fingernails long and sharp. Paul bares his fangs.  They are yellow and bloodstained. He is about to sink them into Edgar's neck when Edgar senses his presence and spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Ahh!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul lunges, but Edgar SQUIRTS him in the face with holy water.  Paul YELLS and SCREAMS and flails his arms, but Edgar continues to SQUIRT and SQUIRT, driving Paul back into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Dwayne grabs Sam and is just about to gouge out his eyes when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duck, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael, recovered, releases an arrow.  It WHOOSHES through the air and sinks into Dwayne's throat. Dwayne ROARS in horror and pain.  So loud is his cry that windows SHATTER and light bulbs POP. Then, as if illuminated from within, Dwayne's body begins to glow.  It CRACKLES with electrical energy.  HISSES and FIZZES.  Then vanishes from sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar shooting holy water as Paul backs into bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan!  Alan!  I'm almost out of ammo!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Michael's bedrooms are connected by the bath- room.  Alan hears Edgar's cry and enters the bathroom fro Sam's side, coming up behind Paul. Alan sees the bathtub filled with holy water and has an idea.  He gets down on his hands and knees behind Paul. Edgar catches on and head-butts Paul, knocking him back- wards.  Paul trips over Alan and falls into the tub with a SPLASH. The water burns!  Paul SCREAM and kicks.  The water turns to a frothy pink and yellow foam -- boiling up, spitting, and shooting into the air like a geyser.  Alan and Edgar jump back.  And in a moment... Paul is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoots through the roof.

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Michael and Sam are about to run upstairs when:

dialogues.speaker: MARKO
dialogues.text: CRASHES up through the window in front of them, blocking their path.  Michael and Sam leap back. Then, Michael looks up -- just as:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: crashes through another window.  Hovering in the air directly overhead; his back pressed against the ceiling. Sam and Michael react as David SWOOPS down on them -- fangs exposed; claws extended.  The boys leap away, but David's claws rake across Michael's back, tearing his shirt and drawing blood. Marko SMASHES the living room lamps and the room goes dark.  Marko and David -- glowing dimly -- soar around the room like bats. Marko and David enjoy the superiority of the air, but Michael has had enough.  Sensing his own ability to fly, he leaps into the air and speeds toward David. Sam looks astonished... and Marko catches him off-guard. He scoops him up and flies him into the kitchen. Michael's flying is not pretty.  He tumbles awkwardly through the air.  But his aim is good.  He COLLIDES with David in mid-air.  Michael ricochets across the room and David is propelled in a new direction as well. The two of them careen from wall to wall like racquet balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar and Alan, still flushed with their victory over Paul, sit on the bed re-loading their guns with holy water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see that sucker burn?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, we totally annihilated his night-stalkin' ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two down and two to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very serious) Four to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whattaya mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those two we brought back with us. The girl and the kid.  I don't trust 'em.  I say we terminate 'em while we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?  You're absolutely right.

dialogues.speaker: LADDIE
dialogues.text: still hiding under the bed is listening to every word the Frogs utter. He begins to transform upon hearing the Frogs' plan. His "human" eyes roll back into his head until his "vampire" eyes -- glowing red slits -- take their place. Laddie opens his mouth and a beam of light shoots out. His fangs begin to descend... POPPING his braces off. Edgar's and Alan's ankles dangle temptingly before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death to all vampires!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maximum body-count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are awesome monster-bashers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meanest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baddest!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frogs are about to exchange another self-congratu- latory high-five when... the mattress begins to erupt between them.  It bulges and heaves and...

dialogues.speaker: LADDIE
dialogues.text: RIPS through it!  Bedcovers are shredded and mattress stuffing and springs explode into the air.  Laddie has transformed into the ugliest, meanest little vampire imaginable. Alan and Edgar SCREAM at the top of their lungs and leap away from the bed in terror.  Laddie virtually pulls the mattress apart, climbs away and advances on the Frogs who cower in the corner like the scared children they are. Star rushes in, sees what's happening, and steps between Laddie and the Frogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laddie... NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frogs are amazed to see Star fearlessly put her arms around Laddie like a comforting mother and calm him down. And Laddie returns to normal before our astonished eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marko advances toward Sam.  Nanook GROWLS.  Sam throws anything he can get his hands on:  Plates, toaster, cups, silverware, etc.  They bounce harmlessly off of Marko's head and chest. Marko continues to advance.  Sam grabs the kitchen fire extinguisher and SPRAYS FOAM into Marko's face.  But it doesn't stop him.  Marko's long, serpent's tongue slips out of his mouth and cleans the foam from his face. Marko just keeps coming.  He opens his mouth revealing a blinding beam of light and long, jagged fangs.  He rushes toward Sam who grabs a round wooden napkin ring and JAMS it into Marko's mouth. The ring props Marko's mouth open and offers a convenient opening through which Sam begins to stuff entire garlic cloves.  Marko's eyes blaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Michael continue their aerial dog-fight. Michael looks like he's getting the worst of it. David gets the edge on him.  He comes up under Michael, grabs him by the waist and continues to fly upward until Michael's head BANGS against the ceiling, knocking him unconscious. Michael drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Marko struggles to remove the napkin ring from his mouth, and Nanook bites his ankles -- Sam continues to stuff garlic down Marko's throat. Suddenly, Marko starts to swell up like a balloon.  Get- ting bigger and bigger, until his face nearly disappears into a puffy, purple ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nanook!  He's going to burst!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Nanook turn away as MARKO EXPLODES O.S. and gooey green slime is splattered over the kitchen. Sam barely has time to savor the thrill of victory before something grabs him by the back of the neck and yanks him into the air. It's David.  He flies out of the kitchen with Sam.

dialogues.speaker: INTO MICHAEL'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Where he hurls Sam across the room.  Star, Laddie, Edgar and Alan are there as well. David points his index finger... and a ribbon of flame shoots out -- like a welder's torch.  Everyone fearfully steps back. David "draws" a wreath of flame around the windows and the door... sealing everyone inside.  But he exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael regains consciousness in time to see David approaching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just you and me now, Michael. One on one.  Fight to the finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael gets slowly to his feet, never taking his eyes off David.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Michael.  You're the only one left.  They're all dead. Sam and Star, too.  All dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael doesn't believe him -- but he looks worried. Then, David attacks.  He leaps at Michael... and the fight is on! Michael grabs a wooden hat rack and swings it like a bat.  It connects with David's head, but David is unphased.  Michael swings again and David catches the hat rack, yanks it from Michael's grasp and SNAPS it in two as if it were a twig.  Michael charges. They tumble through the air, fighting fiercely.  CRASHING from one room to the next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where everyone is trapped.  Sam and Edgar have their ears pressed to the floor, listening to the fight below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and David SLAM each other into walls.  Finally, David picks up Michael's chest and propels him back- wards, two feet off the ground, back --

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Where David traps Michael against the wall, the barbell pressed against his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give up, Michael!  You're one of us.  Don't you understand that? You're one of us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael doesn't listen.  He struggles, but can't free himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to help him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?!  We can't get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at her.  Star turns toward the burning door, contemplates going through it.

dialogues.speaker: STAR
dialogues.text: We realize that for her to go through the door she must allow a bit of the vampire in herself to surface.  A subtle change comes over her... and she opens the burning door and walks through it without harm. Sam, Edgar and Alan exchange a look, then put their ears to the floor again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David presses hard against the barbells.  The weights sink into the wall and the bar itself begins to crush Michael's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David turns to see Star standing behind him.  She holds the pointed, broken hat rack in her hands. David releases his grip on the barbells.  They fall to the floor.  So does Michael -- holding his throat and gasping for air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill me, Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling) I will, David!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Star.  Put it down.  Put it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star's resolve begins to crumble.  We realize that she is incapable of killing David.  He begins to approach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David spins in Michael's direction.  Somehow, Michael has summoned up a hidden reserve of strength.  He holds the barbells in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the barbells through the air toward David who catches them instinctively.  But their weight carries him backwards -- directly into the pointed end of the broken hat rack that Star holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hat rack enters his back, pierces his heart, and exits through his chest. David SCREAMS and BELLOWS and pulls out the stake. Light pours from the hole in his body like a brilliant searchlight. Then David flies up and HITS the ceiling -- still HOWLING and YELLING and SPARKING like a Roman candle. Then -- like a balloon losing its air -- he begins to deflate and ROCKET around the room on a wild, spinning flight. Star and Michael duck to avoid being hit. David is heading toward the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Edgar and Alan have their ears presses to the floor when suddenly, David EXPLODES through the floor only inches away -- and keeps traveling upward, EXPLODING through the bedroom ceiling as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David CRASHES through the roof of the house and disin- tegrates high in the night sky -- like a shooting star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and the Frogs looks at the hole in the floor, then look at the hole in the ceiling... then see the wreath of flames around the door and windows blow out and die. They rush for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Laddie and the Frogs come down the stairs to see Michael holding Star in his arms. All is silent.  And slowly they realize that they have triumphed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Michael) You destroyed David.  His hold on you has been released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam notices that Michael, Star and Laddie don't look pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't feel any differently. (to Star) Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Star shakes her head, no.  They look at Laddie.  He also shakes his head, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means we still haven't destroyed their leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa's pickup rumbles down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights sweep across the front window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks toward the door -- and Max and Lucy enter. They stop dead in their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmygod...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  Is everybody all right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Sam don't know what to say or where to begin.  Then we notice that Max wears and expression of pure anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are my boys?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's David?  Where are the others?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, Michael, the Frogs, Laddie and Star know what Max is talking about, and they react in horror.  But Lucy is still in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max... what are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was all going to be so perfect, Lucy.  One big happy family.  My boys... and yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it!  You are a vampire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Vampire?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you passed the test!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael invited me in.  Never invite a vampire into your house. It renders you powerless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! (to Edgar) Did you know that!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  The invitation protects them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam glares at Edgar.  As if to say, Thanks for nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will somebody please tell me what this is all about!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you I was after all along, Lucy.  To be our day time guardian. I knew if we could bring Sam and Michael into the faimly, there'd be no way you could say no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max peels back his lips revealing his fangs.  Lucy jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still want you, Lucy... I haven't changed my mind about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max advances toward Lucy.  He is the meanest, nastiest, foulest, oldest vampire of them all.  And all the evil and depravity that dwells within his soulless being now manifests itself in his ghastly appearence. Everyone SCREAMS. He moves toward Lucy.  Yellow eyes flashing.  Fangs descending below his jaw.  Skin rancid.  Breath foul. Michael steps between Max and his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't invite you in this time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out, Mom!  Run!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max ROARS and everyone is knocked to the ground and held there by the sound.  Everyone but Michael, that is. He alone is left standing to face Max.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Grandpa arrives home.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Max scoffs at Michael.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, boy.  Come and save your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael and Max do battle.  Michael is brave, but fool- ish.  He doesn't have a chance. Holding Michael by the ankle, Max spins him over his head.  Michael hits against the walls and the bannister, SNAPPING off the rails one by one. Then, Max releases him and Michael sails across the room and lands in a heap.  Exhausted and defeated.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Max smiles to himself, reaches down and pulls Lucy to her feet.  Prepares to sink his fangs into her neck.  She struggles to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fight.  It's so much better if you don't fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lowers his head to her neck.  Lucy looks over his shoulder, sees something through the front window.  With all her strength she pushes away from Max, and...

dialogues.speaker: GRANDPA'S TRUCK
dialogues.text: SMASHES into the front of the house in reverse.  The truck stops, but the fencing material in the truck's bed does not. Several large fence posts CRASH through the picture window... slicing through Max's body like knives through butter! Max ROARS in protest and in pain.  The force of the impaling propels him backwards into the fireplace where his body becomes a VORTEX, drawing into it all that surrounds it. It sounds like the RUSHING OF THE WIND as furniture, drapes, carpets, etc. are sucked into the space that was once occupied by Max's body. Lucy, Sam, Star, Laddie and the Frogs hold on to one another for dear life, lest they get sucked in as well. Michael, too weak to save himself, goes by -- but Star and the Frogs are able to grab hold of him. Nanook also finds himself being sucked in.  But Sam grabs him by the tail and holds him back. Everything else that isn't nailed down (and some things that are, like floorboards) disappear into the swirling vortex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa, from his truck, looks up at the chimney and sees the VAPORIZED CONTENTS of his house being spewed high into the night air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's own head and limbs are consumed in the vacuum, and the vortex beings to subside.  Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone is able to get to their feet now.  Sam sees Max's driving cap on the floor.  He picks it up and tosses it into the now dying vortex. Michael and Star trade joyful expressions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone.  I feel it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do I!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at Laddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael hugs Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone accounted for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa enters from the front yard.  He surveys the scene, then, stepping over the debris, heads into:

dialogues.speaker: THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: and goes directly to the refrigerator.  He pays no attention to the mess or the gooey green slime that coats the walls.  He just opens the door and takes a diet Root Beer from the second shelf. He POPS the top, takes a long swallow and lowers the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) The one thing about livin' in Santa Carla I never could stomach... (beat) All the damn vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is deserted.  CAMERA PROWLS.  Then, one by one, KIDS begin to arrive.  At first we don't recognize them.  But then we realize they are:  The Runaways who Lucy gave food to... Maria from the Video Store... A couple of Surf Naxis... (and perhaps others.)  They are here to take up where the Lost Boys left off. CAMERA PUSHES PAST THEM, toward the old mural painted on the lobby wall.  The mural depicts a typical day on the boardwalk in the year 1900. CAMERA MOVES CLOSER AND CLOSER TO THE MURAL. And HOLDS TIGHT on one painted figure in particular: A man in a straw hat.  He's grinning broadly... and he's most definitely Max.
